subject: "Standard" testing techniques?
msgSnippet: ... Whose standard is that? The standard I see is write lots of code, debug it later, complain. If nothing else, TDD is a behavioral pattern interrupt. It s
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> ... I definitely
> believe that software written using TDD will have a very different
> architecture from another software delivered with standard testing
> techniques ("write the code, write the test, repeat")....

Whose standard is that? The standard I see is write lots of code, debug
it later, complain. If nothing else, TDD is a behavioral pattern
interrupt. It's strong enough to jar those people into turning their
brains on.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
